DOC.brief_summary: Patients undergoing total knee arthroscopy ( knee replacement ) surgery usually receive femoral nerve block part anesthetic care . Some center administer block single shot local anesthetic , wear several hour surgery . Other center administer block single shot follow continuous infusion local anesthetic , typically 2 5 day surgery . The latter method , though good pain control , may result decreased mobility ( anesthetic still active ) , long hospital stay , great risk fall . This study see use low concentration local anesthetic continuous femoral nerve block initial single-shot dose result increase mobility shorter hospital stay .
